posts.description: AJ+ - Syrian Town Starving to Death | Facebook
Beyond Zero and One: Machines, Psychedelics, and Consciousness by Andrew Smart review – inside the minds of computers | Books | The Guardian
posts.extended: Do androids dream of electric Kool-Aid acid tests? If there’s to be any hope for us, they will. That is the message of Andrew Smart’s splendidly mind-bending book, which mashes up Alan Turing, The Matrix, Immanuel Kant, “zombie AI”, Leibniz, and research on psychedelic drugs.

posts.description: Everything You Know About Martin Shkreli Is Wrong—or Is It? | Vanity Fair
posts.extended: “I don’t mean to be presumptuous, but I liken myself to the robber barons.” So says Martin Shkreli, the 32-year-old hedge-fund manager turned pharmaceutical-company C.E.O., who achieved instantaneous notoriety last fall when he acquired the U.S.

posts.description: Ian Brady and Myra Hindley - Criminal Minds Wiki - Wikia
posts.extended: Ian Brady and Myra Hindley, a.k.a. "The Moors Murderers", were a young couple who killed five people, three of them children, together in the 1960s. Brady was born Ian Duncan Stewart in Glasgow, Scotland. His mother was Maggie Stewart, a 28-year-old tearoom waitress.

posts.description: How Stoya took on James Deen and broke the porn industry's silence | Culture | The Guardian
posts.extended: Stoya says she couldn’t sleep. After arriving in Serbia on 18 November to begin work on a film, she had been woken by nightmares.

posts.description: Nightclub bouncer wears GoPro to show the terrors of working NYE
posts.extended: Going out on New Year's Eve is like braving the wild frontier: everyone must fend for themselves, and you will probably end up dirty.
